str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of semaino; an indication, especially ceremonially or supernaturally.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
Infant, babe, child in arms. Of uncertain affinity; an infant literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To swathe, wrap in swaddling clothes. From sparganon; to swathe.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A manger, feeding-trough, stall. From pateomai; a crib.
